title: SBI earns ₹16 trillion PAT in 4 years under Khara, higher than previous 64 years
author: Livemint
description: State Bank of India (SBI) has reported a profit after tax (PAT) for the past four years that exceeds its cumulative profit from the previous 64 years, according to Chairman Dinesh Kumar Khara. SBI's annual profit has risen from ₹14,000 crore to ₹17,000 crore per quarter under Khara's leadership. The bank has attributed this improvement to resolving lending issues, increasing other income, and improving employee productivity. Despite this success, Khara believes SBI is undervalued in the market and is not satisfied with its current valuation. SBI is preparing to launch a beta version of its upgraded mobile banking application, YONO 2.0. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: State Bank of India (SBI) has reported a profit after tax (PAT) for the past four years that exceeds its cumulative profit from the previous 64 years, according to Chairman Dinesh Kumar Khara. SBI's annual profit has risen from ₹14,000 crore to ₹17,000 crore per quarter under Khara's leadership. The bank has attributed this improvement to resolving lending issues, increasing other income, and improving employee productivity. Despite this success, Khara believes SBI is undervalued in the market and is not satisfied with its current valuation. SBI is preparing to launch a beta version of its upgraded mobile banking application, YONO 2.0. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: Dalal Street buzzes with IPO frenzy: Major listings and debuts ahead
author: Money Control
description: Akums Drugs and Pharmaceuticals will make its debut on the stock market on August 6. In addition, Brainbees Solutions, the operator of Firstcry, is launching a significant IPO worth Rs 4,194 crore and Unicommerce eSolutions is set to launch a Rs 277 crore IPO on the same day. Other IPOs closing next week include Ceigall India and Ola Electric Mobility. The SME segment will also see several listings next week, including Aesthetik Engineers, Kizi Apparels, and Utssav Cz Gold Jewels. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: Akums Drugs and Pharmaceuticals will make its debut on the stock market on August 6. In addition, Brainbees Solutions, the operator of Firstcry, is launching a significant IPO worth Rs 4,194 crore and Unicommerce eSolutions is set to launch a Rs 277 crore IPO on the same day. Other IPOs closing next week include Ceigall India and Ola Electric Mobility. The SME segment will also see several listings next week, including Aesthetik Engineers, Kizi Apparels, and Utssav Cz Gold Jewels. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: How YC's biggest startups run A/B tests (with examples)
author: Internet
description: This article explores innovative A/B testing practices of successful Y Combinator startups. Monzo prioritizes quick, low-risk experiments; Instacart solved complex sampling issues for delivery optimization; Coinbase developed 'universes' to scale testing; Airbnb uses interleaving for search results and dynamic p-values for accuracy; and Convoy employs Bayesian testing to encourage more changes. These approaches showcase creative solutions to common A/B testing challenges in various business contexts. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: This article explores innovative A/B testing practices of successful Y Combinator startups. Monzo prioritizes quick, low-risk experiments; Instacart solved complex sampling issues for delivery optimization; Coinbase developed 'universes' to scale testing; Airbnb uses interleaving for search results and dynamic p-values for accuracy; and Convoy employs Bayesian testing to encourage more changes. These approaches showcase creative solutions to common A/B testing challenges in various business contexts. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: Which 3 IPOs will hit the stock market next week?
author: ETN News
description: The upcoming week will see FirstCry-parent BrainBees and SaaS startup Unicommerce launch their IPOs in the mainboard segment on August 6. The sole SME IPO of Aesthetik Engineers will launch on August 8 with a price band of ₹55-58 per share. Apart from this, the stock market is also expected to see 12 listings, including that of Ola Electric. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: The upcoming week will see FirstCry-parent BrainBees and SaaS startup Unicommerce launch their IPOs in the mainboard segment on August 6. The sole SME IPO of Aesthetik Engineers will launch on August 8 with a price band of ₹55-58 per share. Apart from this, the stock market is also expected to see 12 listings, including that of Ola Electric. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: WazirX holds plan to 'socialise' ₹1,965-cr loss from breach: Report
author: CNBC
description: Indian crypto exchange WazirX, that recently suffered losses worth ₹1,965 crore following a security breach, has put its plan to 'socialise' the losses among customers on hold, CNBC-TV18 reported. Following customer backlash, WazirX is now reportedly open to strategic investments, mergers and acquisitions. The exchange will likely propose a new solution to recuperate the losses in next few weeks. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: Indian crypto exchange WazirX, that recently suffered losses worth ₹1,965 crore following a security breach, has put its plan to 'socialise' the losses among customers on hold, CNBC-TV18 reported. Following customer backlash, WazirX is now reportedly open to strategic investments, mergers and acquisitions. The exchange will likely propose a new solution to recuperate the losses in next few weeks. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: Kota startup makes electricity from cow dung, saves ₹2.5L monthly
author: Economic Times
description: Founded in 2015 and based in Kota, Rajasthan, Gau Organics is a dairy farm startup that partners with local farmers and sells natural products like ghee, milk, oil, and jaggery. Recently, Amanpreet Singh, the founder of Gau Organics and his team developed a methane-powered electricity generator that saves approximately ₹2,50,000 to ₹3,00,000 in monthly electricity bills. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

Recently, Amanpreet Singh, the founder of Gau Organics and his team developed a methane-powered electricity generator that saves approximately ₹2,50,000 to ₹3,00,000 in monthly electricity bills. title: Most startups destined to die, even the funded ones: Kunal Shah
author: LinkedIn
description: Entrepreneur Kunal Shah posted on X, 'Most startups are destined to die. Even the funded ones. Startup success is mostly a miracle.' He added, 'And miracle doesn't happen with a team that's looking for stability and dislike ambiguity...Startups need problem solvers.' An X user responded, 'Expecting the whole team - not to look for stability is a far-fetched thought.' Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: CERT-In warns of multiple vulnerabilities in Apple products, asks users to update OS
author: Economic Times
description: The Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) has issued a warning regarding multiple vulnerabilities found in Apple's products and their operating systems for iPhones, iPads, and televisions. These vulnerabilities could potentially allow attackers to gain access to sensitive information, execute malicious code, bypass security measures, cause denial of service, and conduct spoofing attacks. CERT-In recommends that users update their Apple devices to the latest software patches to protect against these possible attacks. In April, Apple had informed users in India and other countries about a Pegasus-like spyware attack targeting their iPhones. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: The Indian Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) has issued a warning regarding multiple vulnerabilities found in Apple's products and their operating systems for iPhones, iPads, and televisions. These vulnerabilities could potentially allow attackers to gain access to sensitive information, execute malicious code, bypass security measures, cause denial of service, and conduct spoofing attacks. CERT-In recommends that users update their Apple devices to the latest software patches to protect against these possible attacks. In April, Apple had informed users in India and other countries about a Pegasus-like spyware attack targeting their iPhones. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: Hinduja Group’s IIHL faces contempt charges in Reliance Capital resolution case | Mint
author: Livemint
description: The administrator of Reliance Capital has accused IndusInd International Holdings Ltd (IIHL) of contempt of court for allegedly failing to meet the terms of the resolution plan set by the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT). The NCLT had directed IIHL to deposit ₹2,500 crore into a designated escrow account by 31 July, an order that has allegedly not been followed. IIHL filed an application seeking modification of the order, but the administrator has opposed granting any relief. The matter will be heard by the NCLT in the upcoming week. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: The administrator of Reliance Capital has accused IndusInd International Holdings Ltd (IIHL) of contempt of court for allegedly failing to meet the terms of the resolution plan set by the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT). The NCLT had directed IIHL to deposit ₹2,500 crore into a designated escrow account by 31 July, an order that has allegedly not been followed. IIHL filed an application seeking modification of the order, but the administrator has opposed granting any relief. The matter will be heard by the NCLT in the upcoming week. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: Intel disappointed investors. For corporate customers, it’s still good enough
author: Livemint
description: Intel's recent poor quarterly earnings have raised concerns about the company's long-term future. The chip maker reported a loss of $1.6 billion for the second quarter and plans to lay off about 15,000 employees as part of cost-saving measures. Intel's struggles to keep up with other tech giants like Cisco, Microsoft, and Dell, and its lack of presence in the AI chip market, have left corporate technology chiefs questioning the company's viability. However, for now, Intel still dominates the PC and server market, and its brand is still recognizable and trusted. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: Intel's recent poor quarterly earnings have raised concerns about the company's long-term future. The chip maker reported a loss of $1.6 billion for the second quarter and plans to lay off about 15,000 employees as part of cost-saving measures. However, for now, Intel still dominates the PC and server market, and its brand is still recognizable and trusted. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: Byju files caveat in SC expecting challenge to NCLAT order
author: Inshorts
description: BYJU'S CEO Byju Raveendran filed a plea in Supreme Court requesting to be heard before the court decides on a likely plea by US lenders opposing NCLAT's order ending insolvency proceedings against BYJU'S. US lenders had objected to the BYJU'S-BCCI settlement, alleging Byju of using money stolen from them. Byju's brother Riju paid for settlement with BCCI using personal assets. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: BYJU'S CEO Byju Raveendran filed a plea in Supreme Court requesting to be heard before the court decides on a likely plea by US lenders opposing NCLAT's order ending insolvency proceedings against BYJU'S. US lenders had objected to the BYJU'S-BCCI settlement, alleging Byju of using money stolen from them. Byju's brother Riju paid for settlement with BCCI using personal assets. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: The big picture behind Google's largest acquisition failure
author: Livemint
description: Alphabet, Google's parent company, recently attempted to acquire cloud security startup Wiz for $23 billion, but the deal fell through. The acquisition would have helped Google strengthen its presence in the cloud market and diversify its revenue streams. However, regulatory concerns and the trend of vendor consolidation in the tech industry may have posed obstacles to the deal. Additionally, the decline in merger and IPO activity in the startup ecosystem has been attributed to high interest rates, uncertain valuations, and political factors. Despite this, Wiz remains confident in its prospects, as cloud security spending continues to outpace other security products and services. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: Alphabet, Google's parent company, recently attempted to acquire cloud security startup Wiz for $23 billion, but the deal fell through. The acquisition would have helped Google strengthen its presence in the cloud market and diversify its revenue streams. However, regulatory concerns and the trend of vendor consolidation in the tech industry may have posed obstacles to the deal. Additionally, the decline in merger and IPO activity in the startup ecosystem has been attributed to high interest rates, uncertain valuations, and political factors. Despite this, Wiz remains confident in its prospects, as cloud security spending continues to outpace other security products and services. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: With smugglers and front companies, China is skirting US AI bans
author: Economic Times
description: In Shenzhen, China, vendors at a market are openly selling microchips that power artificial intelligence (AI) technologies, which the US is trying to keep out of Chinese hands. Despite US export controls, an active trade of restricted AI technology has been found, with businesses and individuals finding ways to bypass the restrictions through front companies, smuggling, and fraudulent shipping labels. The fear is that these chips could accelerate China's military advancements and pose potential threats in terms of cyberattacks and battlefield decision-making. The US is enforcing bans on the export of AI chips, but the effectiveness of these restrictions remains challenging. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: Thought I couldn't be a founder as I wasn't male, alpha: Vineeta
author: Inshorts
description: SUGAR Co-founder and CEO Vineeta Singh said she used to think she didn't have the right to be an entrepreneur because she was not 'an alpha, or male, or genius' or because she didn't get it right in her first and second business. She added, 'I have now realised entrepreneurs come in all shapes and sizes.' Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.

title: Maruti Suzuki will continue efforts in low-cost car segment; budget buyers in focus: Report
author: livemint
description: Maruti Suzuki India plans to continue manufacturing low-cost small cars for budget-conscious consumers, according to RC Bhargava, the company's Chairman. Despite a dip in the small car segment of the passenger vehicle market, Maruti Suzuki aims to meet societal and economic needs by offering affordable and safe options. Additionally, the company is exploring green technologies, including strong hybrids, CNG, and ethanol, to reduce carbon emissions and improve fuel efficiency. Maruti Suzuki is also planning to launch electric vehicles in the near future and has begun trials for biogas production. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.
content: Maruti Suzuki India plans to continue manufacturing low-cost small cars for budget-conscious consumers, according to RC Bhargava, the company's Chairman. Despite a dip in the small car segment of the passenger vehicle market, Maruti Suzuki aims to meet societal and economic needs by offering affordable and safe options. Additionally, the company is exploring green technologies, including strong hybrids, CNG, and ethanol, to reduce carbon emissions and improve fuel efficiency. title: Fratelli Vineyards to debut on exchanges, aims to become ₹650-cr biz by 2028
author: livemint
description: India's second-largest wine brand, Fratelli Vineyards, is preparing to make its debut on the stock exchanges. The company, aiming to become a ₹650-crore enterprise by 2028, recently underwent a share-swap transaction with a listed sister firm. Fratelli Vineyards has seen steady growth in revenue over the past few years, with a focus on the luxury, super-premium, and premium segments. The company plans to expand its production capacity and tap into emerging wine-drinking markets in India. Fratelli Vineyards believes that listing on the stock exchanges will help with brand building and raising capital for future growth. Copyright © 2024 TecheZ. All rights reserved For personal use only.
